# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is a Julia solution for your problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width = 10)
    words = split(s, ' ')
    result = ""
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " $word") > text_width
            result *= "\n" * line
            line = "$word "
        else
            line *= "$word "
        end
    end
    result *= "\n" * line # add the last line 
    return result
end
```

You can test this function with the following example:

```julia
println(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.", 20))
```

This function works by splitting the input string into words and then iterating over each word. It checks if adding a new word to the current line would exceed the maximum text width, and if so, it adds the current line to the result and starts a new one. At the end of the iteration, it adds the last line to the result.
